comment: Avoid at all costs. If I could give a lower grade than a 1, I would. 30 minutes late for all classes. Rambled on for 3 hours. Due to Latex, Lab reports took multiple hours to complete. It is the last day of the semester and professor Chrisohoides has yet to grade any of my lab reports. I cannot stress this enough, DO NOT take his class.

This class is a joke, and not in the "It's so easy' sense. I truly don't know how the university lets him teach this class with this track record. I would advise against taking him or prepare to teach yourself, be confused by how he grades, and learn nothing in class (professional yapper). He's a nice guy but was not able to teach at all.
His class is joke that only he's not in on.
Professional yapper and his lectures make no sense (don't take him)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Probably one of the worst professors I have ever had in my academic career. will show up 15 mins late, yap about nothing for another 30 then keep you after class because he didn't finish what he wanted. his tests are absurdly hard and I would rather have a teacher that didn't speak English rather than this joke of a professor.

I took this professor for Fluids Lab. Overall, the professor knew his stuff but was never on time or completely prepared. I didn't think this affected the quality of his class, however. Yes, I had to learn latex, but it's not very hard. I now have a new skill to add to my resume, and I actually did enjoy it once I learned it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: When I first had his class, I told my parents how much of a cool guy he was and how I knew I was going to love the class, I spoke too soon. There was no REAL rubric, and he was not much help for someone who has never used AutoCAD before. We we so behind that he had to all-in-one assignments. Grades were put incorrectly and on the lat day de, fixed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: First offHe NEVER shows up to class on time and tries to get out as soon as possible and gets irritated answering student questions. His assignments are straight from the book which isn't a problem but you end up teaching yourself AutoCad. The hw (as someone with a little of previous knowledge of AutoCAD) took multiple hours each week to complete.

This is, by far, the worst professor I have ever had. He explains nothing, and has insane standards and will give you an F on assignment for "incorrectly" naming an assignment. He refuses to answer questions and gives vague directions on assignments with extremely short due dates. Please, for your own sanity, do NOT take this professor.

I have him for two of my classes and he is the worst professor I've had this semester. His class will make you want to change majors even if it was something you loved. Posts everything late and expects you to learn everything from the book with very little support outside of that.

Very easy going lab, you just need to know how to use Latex or Overleaf to make the lab reports should be an easy A or B. Third class with him 1 class and 2 labs, mainly recommend for lab only usually because he pass all lab students. Lab grades received never really affect your overall grade in his eyes just going to give you a B or A.

Completely unprepared to teach the course. Didn't follow any kind of syllabus, every assignment was given on the fly with no advanced notice. There was not a single test, but we didn't know that for sure until the course was over. Course was entirely self taught from the book, and the projects are cumulative with previous chapters.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I would wait a semester for a better professor. He is tied for the worst professor I have ever had. He makes you code the PDF for a lab report, making a lab report that should take 1-2 hours take 8-10. He is not consistent with how he grades at all, so after correcting all issues he points out you can get a lower grade than originally.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Avoid like the plague. Makes you use obscure coding platform to submit lab reports

Im not sure if it was just the transition to Online or if it was because it was the summer semester, but this is one of the most poor experiences Ive had with a professor at KSU. Somehow he could talk for lectures that were 4.5 hours long at times and still leave the class with no real clue how to use AutoCAD or Civil3D. Cant recommend him.

Unless you have prior understanding of AutoCAD and Civil3D, never take this class from him. His lectures have hit a maximum of 4.5 hours long and we spend most of our time looking over other people's homework from 2 weeks ago. He makes everything very unclear and has no patience regarding technology problems, despite COVID-19.

I have never taken such a bad professor while attending KSU. I decided to withdrawal from the course because I was on the border of a C/D and didn't want to wreck my GPA if I didn't end up passing. Very nit picking on grading and no partial credit. Do not take if you can avoid his class! I will close with saying that as a person he is nice.
Does not grade at all, won't help with work or answer questions straight forward.

The only reason I'm not using profanity is due to rate my professor's guidelines. Holy mackerel is this guy a piece of work. Late to every class, wastes time during lectures, doesn't communicate expectations well, if you make a mistake he chastises you with no sympathy, it's a miracle I got a B. Problems in tests come from homework. Good Luck.

He is impossible to work with. He is always late to class and never responds to emails. He wastes at least 20 mins of class watching videos to try to figure out how to do the labs and still has no idea how to properly complete them. No student dares to ask questions because they are afraid of his rude and inappropriate responses. Take anyone else.

He's consistently 15 min late to his class & wastes time going off on rants. He shows up not knowing how to set up labs. He did labs incorrectly despite being warned by students. He makes you use a difficult coding program to do lab reports that take days to finish. He's just unprofessional. I'm an A/B student struggling for a C. Avoid at all costs

DO NOT TAKE HIM. He doesn't follow the syllabus or communicate whatsoever about his expectations. He gave us 2 days notice for the first test. He will assign homework due on a Sunday night and finish teaching the material for the unit on the following Monday, forcing you to teach yourself. Wastes so much time in the lecture and is always late.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: AC himself is a very nice and personable guy, and the class itself was fairly simple, but what made the class frustrating is his constant lateness. Even on test days he was a minimum of ten minutes late, and we did not have any homework grades in for months. We had zero feedback on autoCAD homework until after the midterm, which it was mostly over.

One of the worst teachers I've had. I didn't want to take him, but unfortunately he was the only teacher for the class. He always shows up late and he gets off topic so much. He barely explains how to do anything. If you can, avoid him. He's a nice guy, but that doesn't really matter.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Never makes it to class on time. Unorganized and never admits hes wrong. Good guy, just a terrible professor. Do not take

I don't recommend him for this class. I took him because I had statics with him and enjoyed his style, but if you can't teach yourself the material or make it to his office hours, you will not get an A. Maybe not even a B. He has good intentions but doesn't come to class prepared so be ready to spend a 50 minute lecture doing MAYBE one example.

This is definitely his forte class. The tests are similar to the homeworks/examples given in class, so pay attention. Skipping class is not recommended. He rarely curves or gives extra credit so don't slack. He has an accent, but is understandable and hilarious. Get on his good side.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The worst professor I've had at KSU. Late to every class by a minimum of 5 minutes, and then will take at least 10 minutes to start class. Made the class use a program called LaTex which is not very Mac friendly and because he has no mac experience, he could not help me figure it out. Very uncompromising, very condescending, and very unprepared.

gives terrible feedback, tests are stupid hard when it comes to his grading, since he gives no partial credit and if you dont do the work his way then its wrong. LOTS OF HOMEWORK. I averaged out about 10 hours of homework a week. I ended with a 69.4 and he didnt bump my grade and his lectures are pointless. DO NOT TAKE HIM HE IS TERRIBLE!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Worst Professor ever. Teaches material without knowledge of how to solve it. Grades test wrong. Never shows up for office hours. Gives homework without instructions,lazy, computer illiterate, show up for class late if at all, and people walk out of his class during testing out of frustration.

I will say this guy is not the best professor ive had and trust me he is not even close but, He cares that you learn and has a decent interest in you being successful. His grading I would say is fair maybe a little rough but still fair, he's funny which helps, and hes flexible with assignments and such, He's a good guy.

Shows up late everyday. Is never prepared and never does a problem right the first time. Only way he would get stuff right is because of other students helping him. Only gives 3-4 days to do an unnecessarily large amount of homework. The MME online HW made me wanna throw my laptop at a brick wall.

Lectures are great, he explains equations and associated concepts well. Assigns a lot of HW, it counts for 25% of your grade. Tests are fair for the most part. Hes a decent person & cares about students learning. Shows up late everyday & has no concept of time management. Its difficult to see him outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: This dude is a JOKE. Out of 7 labs, he was on time for 1. He has no clue how to run the labs so he just lectures and then lets us struggle to figure out what to do. One of the most anal graders I've ever had. Refused to grade my lab report because I used a space instead of aN underscore when I submitted on D2L. Straight A student and I got a B.

Shows up at least 10 minutes late to almost every class. Tends to get off topic during lecture and wastes time talking about useless information. Not very good at explaining how to do assignments and you're basically left to learn the material yourself.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: NEVER PREPARED! Start class always about 30 minutes late. Its Fall break and I have yet to receive any grades.

His grading system is the worst. If you don't follow the steps taken for a problem from a certain website he will mark the answer completely wrong, almost no partial credit. Avoid this professor at all cost
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I already had a year of architecture experience before taking this class so I thought it was an easy A. Other students were struggling but I thought the course material was easy enough if you came to class and actively participated. He gets lost in thought and gets off topic, but the material is presented straightfoward and he reviews ALOT. Easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He cares about you and is funny, but his class is hard. He sometimes doesn't explain things well and just gives homework about stuff you don't really know yet. I had him for a basic civil graphics (AutoCAD) so I was okay but I imagine if the class had been a higher level class it would have been very difficult because this one was not easy.

He does not cover what he tests on. His homework assignments are graded harshly. He has never been to his office hours on time, and he is late to class 10+min, I have an A in the class, but you are not me. I study every day. The class average on tests is not given, mainly because it would prove his teaching method is whats really failing everyone.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Terrible teacher, even worse grading system. 3 tests worth 15% each, 25% on the final, and 30% homework/quizzes. 5 Questions per test, the most difficult in the book. Always late to class. Heavy accent.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Do not take. I dont care if you have to wait until next semester, this is a fair warning. He is a complete waste of time. His classes are delayed, mainly because he shows up late, and after taking attendance (very slowly) you have 2/3rds the class time you started with. His grading is unfair, and he takes up one of 20 problems, and only grades that
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is not a good professor if you need Statics for upper level courses. He doesn't teach enough. if the class is 1 hr 15 mins long he will let u take the test only 40-45 mins. Show up late, not prepared, does not answer students have questions. doesn't do problems on board. No extra credits, and unfair with grading. Ask most difficult problems.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
